description: Construction of two storey detached dwelling house with associated parking and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.    Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans: Location Map; 5MA/1A; and Design and Access Statement, received 7th January 2014.   Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1, 2.1 & 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Interim Planning Guidance SPD 4,  policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application. REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole,  in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | The refuse and recycling storage shall be implemented in accordance with the Local Planning Authority policies before the first occupation of the dwelling hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter. This area shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area, in accordance with interim planning guidance SPD4, policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 5.3 and 5.17 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the submitted drawings no occupation of the dwelling hereby approved shall take place until full details of garden layouts for the approved dwelling and Nos. 5, 5A and 7 Masefield Avenue, boundary treatments and hard/soft landscape works and a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be completed as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that each dwelling has acceptable private amenity space and that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and screening of the proposal from neighbouring properties, and in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7D of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2011). | No development shall commence until a detailed scheme of the planting of at least two trees on site has been submitted to and approved by Council. The scheme shall include the following comprehensive details of all trees to be planted:  "	Full planting specification - tree size, species and the numbers of trees "	Positions of all proposed species  "	Comprehensive details of graound preparation "	Staking / tying methods "	Five year post-planting maintenance schedule with an agreed inspection schedule  All tree-planting shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved scheme in the nearest planting season (1 October to 31 March inclusive). The quality of all approved landscape works shall be in accordance with British Standard 4428:1989 'Code of Practice for General Landscape Operations' or any subsequent revision. All trees included within the approved scheme shall be healthy, well-formed specimens with single leading shoots and shall be a minimum quality compatible with Britsih Standard 3936:1992 (Part 1) 'Specifications for Trees and Shrubs' and British Standard 4043 (where applicable) or any subsequent revisions. Any trees which die, are signifcantly damaged, become diseased or malformed, or are removed within the first five years following the implementation shall be replaced during the nearest planting season with others of the same size, species and quality as approved.    REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and screening of the proposal from neighbouring properties, and in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the residential dwelling hereby approved shall be constructed to achieve to a minimum Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes (based on November 2010 Technical Guide). The associated reports/ assessment and certifications to demonstrate compliance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval as follows:  "	After commencement of development. Within 3 months of the commencement of construction of the development (Interim Design Stage Assessment and related certification)   "	After completion of Development and prior to first occupation.  A Post-Construction Code for Sustainable Homes Review/Report.  "	6 months after the date of first occupation of the development Post-Construction Stage Certificates verified by the BRE, confirming level 4 has been achieved.  REASON:  To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1 (k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy 5.2 of Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the development hereby approved shall provide secure and sheltered cycle parking for one cycle in accordance with the adopted standards. This shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently thereafter.   REASON:	To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2011). | The vehicular access to the property shall be constructed fully in accordance with the submitted details and once implemented shall be maintained with no obstructions above 0.5 metres in height within the 1.5 metre by 1.5 metre pedestrian visibility splays to either side of the access.    REASON: In the interests of pedestrian and vehicular safety in accordance with policy 6.13 of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 6.3, 6.11, and 6.13 of the London Plan (July 2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | The development hereby approved shall comply with the standards of Secured By Design, be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.1 and 7.3 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
